intro: Lamyropappus schakaptaricus, commonly known as the Schakapta lamyropappus, is a rare flowering plant native to specific regions of South America. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant features narrow, lance-shaped leaves and produces small, yellow flowers that bloom in the spring. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in open, sunny habitats. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a vulnerable species in its native range.
